column4: hey guyz, how do i create a second partition on Linux, so i can dual boot 2 o's?
im a linux moron and cant figure out how to partition
so how do i make it so i can dual boot
i need to make a partition and i also dunno wut i need to do to the boot loader thingy
how do i partition in linux
sudo cfdisk /dev/hda or b or .. but you can create the partition during the windows install
have you edited your sources.list file yet?
sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list just uncomment all the entries
you could always google for ubuntuaddon.zip contains a script and packages for common things
sudo gedit /etc/fstab.  Type mount command in there
system info on right side will say fat or ntfs for windows
